featured.text: Carved from large, straight trees and painted vibrant colors, the totem poles are not just unique works of art.
But what is unique about this shoe is where it was found.
Franklin moistened his fingers and held them against the rims of the glass hemispheres as they turned, producing a unique sound.
(F) They show behavior governed by a unique system of communication.
Each country has its unique naming preferences.

other.text: While offering budget-conscious travelers a unique option, capsule hotels may not be suitable for everyone.
Their unique style, as remarked by Karen Blixen, author of Out of Africa, “has grown from the inside, and is an expression of the race and its history.”
We need to feel the rhythm of the music, hear how it inspires us to move and learn our unique style of movement and expression.
Each of these towns shows unique features of its own.

definition.en_def: Being the only one of its kind; unlike anything else.
definition.example: Her painting has a unique style that captures everyone's attention.
